<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/e6b9796e0425d604ccf4dd4df2733721/tumblr_inline_n5n39gOcyi1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><object data="http://www.twitch.tv/widgets/archive_embed_player.swf" height="378" id="clip_embed_player_flash" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="420"><param name="movie" value="http://www.twitch.tv/widgets/archive_embed_player.swf"><param name="allowScriptAccess" value="always"><param name="allowNetworking" value="all"><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"><param name="flashvars" value="title=A%2Bvery%2Bdodgy%2Btake%2Boff%2Bto%2Bsave%2Bmy%2Bship&channel=n1tch&auto_play=false&start_volume=25&chapter_id=4123397"></object></p>

<p><strong><a class="channelname" href="http://www.twitch.tv/n1tch/profile">N1tch</a> </strong>got himself into a bit of a weird spot. He landed on a slope on the Mun and was forced to take off before he fell into some big trouble. How will it turn out? Watch the video for more!</p>
Been there, done that a few times - and failed more than a few times! Well done for getting out of trouble N1tch.
Hehe, Well saved sir. It's amazing how a slope can look so insignificant from above, only to become a huuge problem at the last minute.
